<entry name="Artillery0Description" value="Indirect fire requires remote target acquisition, usually by a forward observer, but Pandora's unpredictable gravitational interference has made accurate long range artillery wildly unreliable.
Guided indirect artillery disposes of the human component in favor of a drone observer which can provide in-flight corrections to heavy ordnance projectiles for accurate bombardment over extreme ranges."/> <entry name="Artillery0Properties" value="Artillery weapon

<entry name="Automatic1Description" value="Recording and studying thousands of gunfights in real wars, has allowed us to model typical combatant and projectile patterns, opening the door for a new generation of automatic weapons. Weapons like the Gauss gun attempt to compensate for all uncertainties encountered on the battlefield. Stochastically-adjusted flight curves considerably increase the weapon's average accuracy.
The troops have given a... mixed response to the Gauss tech. Veteran soldiers are especially wary of guns whose aims stray on purpose, no matter what "theoretical nonsense" might lurk behind it."/> <entry name="Automatic1Properties" value="Automatic weapon
